desc: Located in urban San Jose, just 1.5 miles from downtown, this tasting room gives visitors samples of vintages produced from extensive plantings in cool-climate estate vineyards in Monterey County, as well as vineyards in Paso Robles and Napa Valley. With 3,700 acres of sustainably farmed ...MORE

South of South Jose, family-owned Guglielmo Winery has made wines for over 80 years. Its tasting room offers samplings of numerous Private Reserves from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Pinot Noir and Chardonnay to Syrah, Petite Sirah and Zinfanel, as well as hard to find Italian-accented specialties ...MORE

Rob and Diana Jensen founded this winery after they abandoned their high-tech careers, initially producing just 25 cases in their garage. Success in the form of regular 90-plus scores and high rankings by influential aficionados like Robert Parker Jr. has boosted their annual output above 15,000 ...MORE

Nestled in the picturesque San Mateo hillside just east of Half Moon Bay on Hwy. 92, this is a great place to go for wine tasting or a group event. La Nebbia Winery features a variety of award-winning wines, including Chardonnay, Riesling, Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Port. The tasting ...MORE
With over 75 years of winemaking, this family-run winery specializes in wines from the Santa Cruz Mountains, producing Pinot Noir, Merlot, Pinot Grigio and Chardonnay.
Founded in 1983 by celebrated “Rhône Ranger” Randall Grahm, this winery focuses on unique and distinctive wines that are expressive of place. The flagship Cigare family—Le Cigare Volant ...more
Established in 1973, this winery produces Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, and Syrah from both estate vines as well as from other small Santa Cruz Mountains vineyards.
Located in an Old World estate chateau on a point overlooking the Monterey Bay, this winery offers tastings of intensely structured Pinots and Chardonnays, classics of the robust California style.

Located in the heart of Saratoga village, Cinnabar Winery produces award-winning wines from the Santa Cruz Mountains, California’s Central Coast, and other distinguished growing regions such as Sonoma County.

This winery makes award-winning Chardonnay and Pinot Noir from cooler Santa Cruz Mountains vineyards, while growing Bordeaux-style reds and whites within its 150 acre estate vineyard in warmer San Martin (25 miles south of San Jose).
This winery on the hillside above Saratoga produces estate-grown varietals from the four principal grape-growing regions of France: Bordeaux, Loire, Burgundy, and Rhone.
Founded in 1961, this winery in the mountains above Saratoga specializes in estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay.

Located on a historic ranch, this winery is one of the oldest wineries in California, offering a variety of award winning wines from various regions.

This small winery is dedicated to wines for which the Santa Cruz Mountains' region is well suited for: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Zinfandel.
